description: Two sisters discover that their quiet coastal town is haunted by ghosts, but are they something to fear, or embrace?
title: GHOSTS
author: Raina Telgemeier

description: Callie becomes the stage manager for her middle school’s production of "Moon Over Mississippi."
title: DRAMA
author: Raina Telgemeier

description: Raina experiences braces, boy troubles and other plagues of the sixth grade.
title: SMILE
author: Raina Telgemeier

description: Representative John Lewis describes his childhood and the beginning of his involvement in the civil rights movement. The first volume of a trilogy.
title: MARCH: BOOK ONE
author: John Lewis and Andrew Aydin

description: This book features more than 100 short stories with the proceeds going to Equality Florida and its fund for those affected by the attack at the Pulse nightclub last year in Florida.
title: LOVE IS LOVE
author: various

description: In her first memoir, the author chronicles the life and death of her father, a closeted gay man and funeral director. First published in 2006.
title: FUN HOME
author: Alison Bechdel

description: The author’s life in Iran during and after its 1979 revolution; first published in 2003.
title: PERSEPOLIS
author: Marjane Satrapi

description: Raina is stuck in the back seat between her younger brother and sister for a weeklong road trip in this family memoir.
title: SISTERS
author: Raina Telgemeier

description: Four friends start a babysitting business in this all-color adaptation of the first book in the series.
title: THE BABY-SITTERS CLUB GRAPHIX: KRISTY'S GREAT IDEA
author: Ann M Martin and Raina Telgemeier

description: Astrid decides to join a summer roller derby camp before she begins junior high, but can she keep up with the older girls?
title: ROLLER GIRL
author: Victoria Jamieson
